resources: Movement to Contact Version 1.0 - January 2017 HelpActivity Music Sound Effects %1$s attacked %2$s %1$s took casualties %1$s took casualties and is suppressed %1$s was attacked, but took no no casualties %1$s is no longer combat effective No emey unit detected Movement To Contact - Turn %1$s (%2$s) You Enemy Scrub is easy to move through but does not provide any cover. Woods can help conceal enemy units and do provide some cover when defending. Rocky terrain is tough to move into, but provides great benefits when defending against an attack. Scrub Woods Rocky %1$s (Not combat effective) %1$s (suppressed) %1$s (%2$d move left and can attack) %1$s (%2$d move left and cannot attack) %1$s (already attacked this turn) Cannot move or attack here Enemy infantry squads are not as strong as your platoons, but can easily disappear back into the terrain when you are not adjacent to them. An enemy machine gun team that can attack two squares away. Enemy sniper teams can pin down your units from a greater distance and cause them to be suppressed easily. A headquarters unit can remove suppression from any unit it is adjacent to at the end of the your turn. Plus, any enemy unit within two squares always remains visible. However, it doesn\'t pack much of an offensive punch.\ The infantry platoon consists of several squads and a mixture of semi-automatic rifles and machine guns. Infantry platoons can only attaack adjacent enemy units. The machine gun section provides the company with additional firepower and can attack enemy units two squares away. The mortar section provides an indirect attack capability up to five squares away. The mortar section can also conduct \"recon by fire\" by attacking into terrain to identify any potential enemy units hiding there.
